items.title: Fix Statemint - Aura Key Scheme
items.content:
After Shell successfully processed the runtime upgrade to Statemint and handed over block production to the Statemint collators, they were not able to produce blocks due to a mismatch in key types. Specifically, Aura uses sr25519 keys to sign blocks, but the keys in the genesis chain spec were generated using ed25519.

A new runtime was created as a temporary fix. This runtime enables ed25519 in Aura for Statemint. This will be enacted on the Relay Chain so that validators will be able to validate the collator signatures. After the chain is producing blocks again, a follow up runtime upgrade will migrate Aura back to using sr25519 keys.

Call hash: `0x0e21b5233c7591ee89eca0cae71cf9a9a4c45fe2393075ab33361a673f5d322d`

Preimage:
![](https://i.imgur.com/pUVsJGR.png)

items.title: Upgrade Shell to Statemint (with XCM Fix)
items.content:
This is a follow up to [Referendum 46](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referendum/46), which failed because Polkadot did not have a default XCM version set. This protection, that the Relay Chain will not dispatch messages without a minimum safe version, was put in place after a previous vulnerability. Since this is the first cross-chain interaction that Polkadot has had, the version was not initialized.

The batch of calls contains the same two calls as Referendum 46, with an additional call to set the default XCM version of Polkadot to 2.

![](https://i.imgur.com/DLFYewu.png)
![](https://i.imgur.com/wJzxnkv.png)

items.title: Upgrade Shell to Statemint
items.content:
This will be a batch of two scheduled transactions. They would probably work fine at once, but will schedule to be safe and ensure that the `set_storage` takes place prior to authorizing the upgrade.

The first will set some storage keys in Shell for Statemint's "genesis". The second will authorize the upgrade to Statemint. Both calls need to be constructed on Shell and then dispatched from the Relay Chain in an XCM.

See the [release notes](https://github.com/paritytech/cumulus/releases/tag/statemint-v6.0.1) to review the assets, reproduce the `set_storage` call, and generate the runtime.

## Shell Constructions

### Set Storage

The `set_storage` call can be generated with the `build-spec` command from a collator node, using `statemint_genesis.json` as input. See the release notes for more info. Notable storage items include:

- Setting the first set of Aura collators.
- Setting the `SafeXcmVersion` to `2` to protect against older XCM formats.

Call data (statemint_genesis_values.scale):

```

```

### Authorize Upgrade

This message authorizes the upgrade of Shell to a runtime with a given hash (statemint_runtime-v601.compact.compressed.wasm). Once the upgrade is authorized, anyone can submit the runtime via `parachain_system.enact_authorized_upgrade`, and it will upgrade 600 blocks (approximately 1 hour) later.

Call data: `0x0103af49687b93d91fc08c1fcea1001d724a95c533a949019645d3e4179beedbf67e`

![](https://i.imgur.com/rHrTJRx.png)

## Polkadot Proposal

This proposal is to schedule these messages to dispatch from Polkadot to Shell. They will dispatch 5 and 20 blocks after enactment to ensure each is processed separately. We give them plenty of weight (100 billion and 1 billion, respectively) to ensure they execute.

Call hash: `0xa6830793b6a3473f66fbd7305a9e330dd2dd688df0e8fcbd0c9ff08d28040a34`

![](https://i.imgur.com/5D8syF9.png)
![](https://i.imgur.com/YmVC8o3.png)

items.title: Proposal for First Parachain Auctions on Polkadot
items.content:
Proposal for First Parachain Auctions on Polkadot

This is a proposal to schedule the first set of parachain auctions on Polkadot as well as get
Council buy-in to a recommended strategy for scheduling auctions on a 3-6 month basis.

Based on the performance of parachains on Kusama and the state of audits, the Parity engineering
team believes that the code for parachains, auctions, and crowdloans is ready for an initial
production release.

This motion proposes two batches of auctions:

- The first: five auctions, starting 11 Nov, seven days each, beginning every _seven_ days, for
  lease periods 6-13 (LP6 is slated to begin 15 Dec)
- The second: six auctions, starting 23 Dec, seven days each, beginning every _14_ days, for
  lease periods 7-14 (LP7 is slated to begin 09 Mar 2022)

As auctions can take place prior to a lease period starting, this motion schedules auctions to
begin around mid-day (UTC) of 11 November.

In order to ensure stability guarantees, I suggest along with this proposal that the Council and
network governance limit the number of parachain slots on Polkadot to 75% of that on Kusama. This
initial schedule will last until early March; as the network grows the Council can suggest an
updated auction cadence to stay within a reasonable factor of safety relative to the number of
parachains on Kusama.

items.content:

items.title: Increasing nominatorsâ€™ min bond on Polkadot
items.content:
The staking team requested a new proposal to increase the minimum bond and allow new nominators above the threshold to participate in the networkâ€™s security mechanism. As mentioned by the Staking team on [this message](https://matrix.to/#/!FdCojkeGzZLSEoiecf:web3.foundation/$YNsqfhHKXoRbW_QKvtG5EKn8HodUGFts6abJJdSAoVA?via=matrix.parity.io&via=matrix.org&via=corepaper.org), Polkadot currently has 22500 nominators and the configuration of the staking system prevents further nominators to join.

The team suggests to update the staking parameters: The proposal has the goal to increase the minimum bond to allow new nominators above the threshold to participate in the networkâ€™s security mechanism, and for less staked nominators to be chilled. **Note that after the latest runtime upgrade (9090), existing nominators can always update their preference at all conditions.**

The proposal the team suggested aims to change the staking parameters to allow more nominators with higher backing stake be able to join the staking system. The existing parameters as follows:

- Minimum validator bond: None
- Maximum validator count: `1200`
- Minimum nominator bond: `80` DOT
- Maximum nominator count: `22500`
- Chill threshold: 90%

The new proposed parameters aim to update one value:

- NewÂ minimum nominator bond: `120` DOTs

The team aims to increase the limit enough so that we won't need to do another tweak for at least a month. **Multiple tracks of optimization are ongoing by the development team**, and you can read more about them on thisÂ [issue](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/issues/9511). Furthermore, a monthly progress report will be released [here](https://gist.github.com/kianenigma/aa835946455b9a3f167821b9d05ba376)Â to communicate the technical details. Please note that increasing the value of the parameter to **120 DOTs** will hopefully give the team another more time until the new threshold is reached and we have made progress on a more permanent solution. Please leave your comments and feedback on the proposal. Keep in mind these measure is **temporary**, and the overall goal is the stability and security of the network.

- Preimage [HERE](https://drive.google.com/file/d/10FRH_Hzs8kqwI_lfMZhC6bu6Dt0bQdCf/view?usp=sharing) - submitted.
- Hash: `0xb862a50c4e8541c013637e9766f3059af75218f0f9630dc8b6c85dc8f633a971`

Please vote at your convenience!

items.title: Increasing nominatorsâ€™ minimum bond on Polkadot
items.content:
As mentioned by the Staking team on [this message](https://matrix.to/#/!FdCojkeGzZLSEoiecf:web3.foundation/$YNsqfhHKXoRbW_QKvtG5EKn8HodUGFts6abJJdSAoVA?via=matrix.parity.io&via=matrix.org&via=corepaper.org), Polkadot currently has 22500 nominators and the configuration of the staking system prevents further nominators to join. 

The team suggests to update the staking parameters as soon as the next runtime upgrade happens today. The proposal has the goal to increase the minimum bond to allow new nominators above the threshold to participate in the networkâ€™s security mechanism, and for less staked nominators to be chilled. Note that after 9080, the existing nominators can always update their preference at all conditions. 

The proposal the team suggested will change the staking parameters to allow more nominators with higher backing stake be able to join the staking system. The existing parameters as as follows:

* minimum validator bond: None
* maximum validator count: `1200`
* minimum nominator bond: `40` DOTs
* maximum nominator count: `22500`

**The new proposed parameters will update one value:**
* newÂ minimum nominator bond: `80` DOTs

and set a new parameter that did not existed before:
* chill-threshold: 90%

The reasoning behind the new minimum nominator bond: Polkadot onboards ~150 nominators per day. That means if the network has 4500 empty slots, they will be filled in 30 days. The team aims to increase the limit enough so that we won't need to do another tweak for at least a month. Changing this parameter to `80` will almost expose 4500 nominators. 

The newÂ chill-thresholdÂ will ensure that the permissionlessÂ `chill_other`Â can only be used when more than 90% of "maximum nominator count" is used.
note that to ensure polkadot's stability until the parachains launch, this motion does not yet include an increase in the total count of nominators. Multiple tracks of optimization are ongoing by the development team, and you can read more about them in thisÂ [issue](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/issues/9511).

Please note that doubling the value of the parameter to `80` DOTs will hopefully give the team more time until the new threshold is reached and we have made progress on a more permanent solution. Please leave your comments and feedback on the proposal. Keep in mind these measures are temporary, and the overall goal is the stability and security of the overall network. 


- Preimage can be found [HERE](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ZdXO1y6_UUlsjaPZgNla6elaMUQgtOxS/view?usp=sharing).

- Hash: `0xc8ca426c26fc637ab82f56e69e91469c6c7205b01609e7970c0ed11cc0c7981f`
- Encoded call data: `0x07170040b743ba00000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000001e457000001b0040000015a`

items.title: Runtime v9080 on Polkadot Network
items.content:
The proposal,Â upgrading Polkadot Runtime toÂ **v9080**,Â is up for vote. Release notes, runtime changes and proposal hash can be found [HERE](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/releases/tag/v0.9.8). 

This release introduces a **new host function**: As such, node operators should upgrade before the next runtime upgrade on their chain in order to continue being able to sync the chain. 

Please vote at your earliest convenience!

items.title: Upgrade the nomination limits on Polkadot
items.content:
The proposal will upgrade the nomination limits such that more people can start nominating. Note that this is a time-sensitive action, because currently existing nominators cannot change their intentions. [This pull request](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/9193) will change this logic, so that those who are already a nominator will not be affected by any limit, and **will be placed in the next Polkadot  runtime upgrade**.

The new limits increase the nominator capacity by `2500` (making it `22500` in total), and increase the the stake threshold to `40DOTs`. It is intended that these numbers would keep the current count of nominators (all of whom must have 40 or more DOTs) below the new count limit (`22500`) **until the next runtime upgrade**: If an influx of nominators is observed over a very short period of time, the stake limit might need to be increased again proportionally to keep the staking system stable.

Preimage [HERE](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Pp8mkUkFCkYiauUAe2RXFBhzk5wgulGV/view?usp=sharing).

Please vote at your convenience!

items.title: Limit on the maximum number of validators, based on scaling issues
items.content:
The proposal **sets a limit on the maximum number of validators**, namely `1200`, and leaves the rest of the parameters unchanged (`20000`/`20DOTs`) for nominators. This proposal started as an **external motion**, meaning that if the Council passes this, the community needs to vote in referenda queue to be executed. 

The validator community should be aware that the discussion around minimum DOT stake limit for validators (similar to what was imposed recently on nominators) has already begun [on the Polkadot Direction channel](https://matrix.to/#/!OwgojQyBzTlUQGGLhq:matrix.parity.io?via=matrix.parity.io&via=matrix.org&via=corepaper.org), and will be proposed **as soon as discussion reaches consensus**. Similar to the nominator limits, **these limits are for the safety of the network and will grow as the network grows.**

The preimage of this proposal can be found [HERE](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1W8J1zSPobzNMSAoAWaSeTWvLRI7QdmwH/view?usp=sharing). 

Context on why this is needed and an explanation of the scaling issues we are seeing on Polkadot NetworkÂ can be found on the [last runtime upgrade post](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/motion/88).

Please vote at your convenience!

items.title: Runtime v9050 on Polkadot Network
items.content:
The proposal,Â upgrading Polkadot Runtime toÂ v9050,Â is up for vote. Release notes, runtime changes and hash can be found [HERE](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/releases/tag/v0.9.5). This release resolves the scaling issues we are seeing on Polkadot Network with staking, introducing hard limits on the number of nominators on chain: which is configurable with governance.

- Previous discussions about the runtime upgrade on the Polkadot Direction channel can be found [HERE](https://matrix.to/#/!OwgojQyBzTlUQGGLhq:matrix.parity.io/$EVsIkHKQaZHNrnOCSrLWwE918yPa3u6srpziFs4usvo?via=matrix.parity.io&via=matrix.org&via=corepaper.org).
- Weiâ€™s post on Polkadotâ€™s staking election situations, problems and discussions about potential solutions can be found [HERE](https://corepaper.org/polkadot/staking/). 
- The blogpost by Polkadot explaining the staking limitations and changes with this runtime upgrade proposal can be found [HERE](https://polkadot.network/polkadot-and-kusama-staking-changes/).

Please vote at your earliest convenience!

items.content:

items.title: A proposal to gradually increase the number of validators
items.content:
**Motion 25** schedules an increase of validators slots by 1 every era (14,400 blocks) with a repetition of 100 eras. 

The motion is to be voted on referenda queue if passed by council for approx. 7 days, after the TC fast-tracks, as explained [here](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/post/93). Councillors: **to verify presage hash** you can check [here](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/post/93#3baa6f49-06c7-4d47-9cb8-44bd19f789d6). Feel free to add any comments or questions.

items.title: Init HRMP open channel request to HydraDX
items.content:
The referendum to open a init a hrmp open channel request to HydraDX already passed: https://zeitgeist.subsquare.io/democracy/referendum/25

The XCM was executed: https://zeitgeist.subscan.io/xcm_message/polkadot-38b400483edbc6df7afb9ca87f1319f891f72846

However, although the message was sent to Polkadot and execute, the channel was not opened. This is due to the circumstance the parachain sovereign account of Zeitgeist on Polkadot had not enough funds to reserve for opening a channel. The account is now funded appropriately and the XCM can be resend.
